TITLE: Installing NumPy with pip
DESCRIPTION: Installs NumPy using pip, which is the package installer for Python that installs from the Python Package Index (PyPI).
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NumPy with Conda
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Conda environment, activates it, and installs NumPy. Conda is an integrated solution for managing packages, dependencies, and environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda create -n my-env
conda activate my-env
conda install numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NumPy with pip in a virtual environment
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Python virtual environment, activates it, and installs NumPy using pip for better dependency management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv my-env
source my-env/bin/activate  # macOS/Linux
my-env\Scripts\activate     # Windows
pip install numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Verifying NumPy Installation
DESCRIPTION: A Python script to verify that NumPy is correctly installed by importing it and printing its version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import numpy as np
print(np.__version__)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NumPy with uv
DESCRIPTION: Installs NumPy using the uv package manager, which is a modern Python package manager designed for speed and simplicity.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv pip install numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NumPy with pixi
DESCRIPTION: Installs NumPy using pixi, a cross-platform package manager for Python and other languages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pixi add numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NumPy with Homebrew on macOS
DESCRIPTION: Installs NumPy using the Homebrew package manager for macOS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
brew install numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NumPy with APT on Linux
DESCRIPTION: Installs NumPy using the APT package manager on Debian-based Linux distributions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo apt install python3-numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing NumPy with Chocolatey on Windows
DESCRIPTION: Installs NumPy using the Chocolatey package manager for Windows.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/install.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
choco install numpy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using redraw-numpy-dep-charts.sh
DESCRIPTION: Main script to generate NumPy dependency charts for multiple packages. Takes an optional output directory parameter. Requires git, python3, pip3, and virtualenv to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/scripts/pkgdepchart/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
redraw-numpy-dep-charts.sh outputdir
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using fetch-numpydeppkg.sh
DESCRIPTION: Helper script to download and install a package in a virtual environment for dependency analysis. Sets up the directory structure for graph generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/scripts/pkgdepchart/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
fetch-numpydeppkg.sh package_name scratchdir git_url reqfile_parentdir
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using gen-numpy-dep-graph.sh
DESCRIPTION: Helper script to generate NumPy dependency charts as PNG files using graphviz and dot utilities. Requires pre-installed packages in a virtual environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/scripts/pkgdepchart/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
gen-numpy-dep-graph.sh package_name scratchdir output_graphdir highlight_color
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using cleanup-numpydeppkg.sh
DESCRIPTION: Helper script to uninstall packages and clean up resources created by fetch-numpydeppkg.sh. Removes virtual environment and package sources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/scripts/pkgdepchart/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cleanup-numpydeppkg.sh package_name scratchdir reqfile_parentdir
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing NumPy Website Git Submodules
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize and update git submodules containing the website theme.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git submodule update --init --recursive
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Hugo Development Server with Make
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Hugo development server using Make.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make serve
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Hugo Development Server Manually
DESCRIPTION: Alternative commands for starting the Hugo development server without Make, useful for Windows users.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python gen_config.py
hugo server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Team Lists with GitHub Token
DESCRIPTION: Command to update the teams gallery using a GitHub token with read:org permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export GH_TOKEN=xxxxxxxxxx
make teams
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Grid Layout Structure with TOML Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This code defines a grid layout using TOML configuration within a Hugo-compatible template. It creates a responsive grid with 6 information cards describing NumPy's key features and benefits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/_index.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: toml
CODE:
```
[[item]]
type = 'card'
title = 'Powerful N-dimensional arrays'
body = '''
Fast and versatile, the NumPy vectorization, indexing, and broadcasting concepts are the de-facto standards of array computing today.
'''

[[item]]
type = 'card'
title = 'Numerical computing tools'
body = '''
NumPy offers comprehensive mathematical functions, random number generators, linear algebra routines, Fourier transforms, and more.
'''

[[item]]
type = 'card'
title = 'Open source'
body = '''
Distributed under a liberal [BSD license](https://github.com/numpy/numpy/blob/main/LICENSE.txt), NumPy is developed and maintained [publicly on GitHub](https://github.com/numpy/numpy) by a vibrant, responsive, and diverse [community](/community).
'''

[[item]]
type = 'card'
title = 'Interoperable'
body = '''
NumPy supports a wide range of hardware and computing platforms, and plays well with distributed, GPU, and sparse array libraries.
'''

[[item]]
type = 'card'
title = 'Performant'
body = '''
The core of NumPy is well-optimized C code. Enjoy the flexibility of Python with the speed of compiled code.
'''

[[item]]
type = 'card'
title = 'Easy to use'
body = '''
NumPy's high level syntax makes it accessible and productive for programmers from any background or experience level.
'''
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Team Grid Layouts in Markdown/HTML
DESCRIPTION: Uses Hugo shortcode grid components to display various NumPy team members from TOML data files. Each grid specifies the source file and column configuration for responsive layouts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/teams/index.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{{< grid file="maintainers.toml" columns="2 3 4 5" />}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Hugo SCSS Transform Error Message
DESCRIPTION: Example error message shown when Hugo extended version is not installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
error: failed to transform resource: TOCSS: failed to transform "style.sass"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Figure with Hugo Shortcode in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet uses Hugo's figure shortcode to display the 2020 NumPy user survey report cover image with specified attributes including source path, alt text, and width.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/user-survey-2020.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
{{< figure >}}
src = '/surveys/NumPy_usersurvey_2020_report_cover.png'
alt = 'Cover page of the 2020 NumPy user survey report, titled "NumPy Community Survey 2020 - results"'
width = '250'
{{< /figure >}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Hugo Page Frontmatter Template
DESCRIPTION: Basic Hugo template that generates frontmatter for new content pages. Uses the page name with hyphens replaced by spaces and title-cased, includes the current date, and sets draft status to true.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/archetypes/default.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hugo
CODE:
```
---
title: "{{ replace .Name "-" " " | title }}"
date: {{ .Date }}
draft: true
---
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring 404 Page YAML Frontmatter
DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter configuration for a 404 error page that sets the title and disables the sidebar display.
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/404.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
title: 404 
sidebar: false
---
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Privacy Policy Frontmatter
DESCRIPTION: YAML frontmatter configuration for the privacy policy page that disables sidebar display
SOURCE: https://github.com/numpy/numpy.org/blob/main/content/en/privacy.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
---
title: Privacy Policy
sidebar: false
---
```
